entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warm Temperatures through Sunday... Highest temperatures are expected today and possibly Saturday with temperatures warming into the upper 60s along the northern and central gulf coast and into the low 70s along the southern Gulf coast. A marine layer will continue to rebuild in the overnight hours along the coast through the weekend. This could

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 8:16AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall and Rising River Levels This Weekend... Heavy rainfall across Brooks Range and North Slope will result in rising water levels on streams and rivers. Rainfall totals of 1.0 to 1.5 inches are expected Friday evening through Saturday evening from the Colville River near Umiat east to the Ivishak River. Water levels will rise significantly and may approach
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 8:15AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall and Rising Rivers This Weekend... Heavy rainfall is expect tonight and Saturday across the Central and Eastern Brooks Range. This will cause rising water levels on streams and rivers draining the Central and Eastern Brooks Range this weekend. Rainfall totals of 1.0 to 1.5 inches are expected tonight through Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 8:02AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WATER LEVELS ACROSS MATSU RIVERS AND STREAMS NEXT 24 HOURS... River levels have risen to high flow over the last 12 hours due to to recent rainfall. Rivers should rise to near bankfull, but should remain below flood levels at area rivers and streams, including Willow Creek near Willow and Talkeetna River above the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Rivers Through the Weekend... Numerous rain showers through Saturday will cause rises on rivers and streams in the Western and Central Brooks Range through the weekend. Additional rainfall of 0.75 to 1.50 inches is expected through Saturday. People in this area should remain alert for the possibility of rising water levels through the weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:05PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Heat Index Values Saturday Afternoon... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 110 degrees Saturday afternoon across the inland Coastal Plains. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water and take frequent breaks from the heat to reduce risk of heat related
entry.cap:areaDesc: Atascosa; De Witt; Fayette; Gonzales; Karnes; Lavaca; Wilson
